article_title: A Beacon In The Bleak Landscape of Health Reform? With A Five-Year Term, Aetna's Retiree Care Plus Plan Takes The Long View

article_metadata.description: I recently interviewed Dr. Randall Krakauer, MD, Aetna's National Medical Director, about Aetna's new Retiree Care Plus plan for Medicare beneficiaries whose former employers pay for their Medicare premiums as a retiree benefit. The key advantage of Retiree Care Plus is that the contract lasts for five years. Traditionally, group benefits, whether for employees or retirees, are negotiated annually. According to Dr. Krakauer: "Better management of chronic illness presents an extraordinary opportunity for Medicare and to do so requires multiple year effort and multiple year commitment".
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary
